messages.content: Marv, experienced developer, suggests clear method names based on functional descriptions, following Java naming conventions.

If the number of arguments in the specified constructor is non-zero and the class of old instance explicitly declares an 'equals' method, this method returns the value of old instance equals new instance.
Returns whether the representation class for this data flavor is java.nio.CharBuffer or a subclass thereof.
Deprecated as of JDK version 1.1, replaced by is multiple mode.
This method instructs the bean that it is OK to use the GUI.
Dispatches an event to the active input method.

Bean context services listener callback, propagates event to all currently registered listeners and bean context services children, if this bean context service does not already implement this service itself.
Deprecated as of JDK version 1.1, replaced by get selected checkbox.
Checks if this window is showing on screen.
Subclasses may implement this method to allow class data to be stored in the stream.
Returns the hashcode for this menu shortcut.
Add a property change listener to the listener list.
Removes the specified component from this layout.
Checks out a tile for writing.
Deprecated as of JDK version 1.1, replaced by set selected checkbox checkbox.
Gets the bean context services listener if any of the specified child.
Returns whether the representation class for this data flavor is java.nio.ByteBuffer or a subclass thereof.
Write a portion of a string to the buffer.
Converts this font object to a string representation.
Returns the device configuration associated with this Graphics2D.
Gets the singleton instance of the system clipboard which interfaces with clipboard facilities provided by the native platform.
This method is called by the current keyboard focus manager requesting that this key event dispatcher dispatch the specified event on its behalf.
Enables or disables input method support for this component.
Returns the number of milliseconds this robot sleeps after generating an event.
This method is called by the AWT event dispatcher requesting that the current keyboard focus manager dispatch the specified event on its behalf.
Removes the specified window state listener so that it no longer receives window events from this window.
The set properties method is part of the Image Consumer API which this class must implement to retrieve the pixels.
Removes the specified component from this border layout.
Removes the specified item listener so that it no longer receives item events from this choice menu.

Deprecated this method does not properly convert bytes into characters as of JDK 1.1, the preferred way to do this is via the toString(String enc) method, which takes an encoding-name argument, or the toString method, which uses the platform's default character encoding.
A new service is available from the nesting bean context.
Deprecated as of JDK version 1.1, replaced by get unit increment.
Creates a new handler for SAX parser that can be used to parse embedded XML archives created by the XML encoder class.
Repaints the specified rectangle of this component within tm milliseconds.
Writes a boolean value to this output stream.
Removes a listener for the value change.
Writes a portion of a string.
Returns the family name of this font, localized for the specified locale.
Get the accessible text associated with this object.
Fire a bean contextship event on the bean context membership listener interface.
Returns the page format of the page specified by page index.
Deprecated as of JDK version 1.1, replaced by set block increment.
Write the specified object to the object output stream.
Handles the item state changed event by invoking the item state changed methods on listener - a and listener - b.
Returns the orientation of this page format.
Used to indicate whether of not we are running in an environment where GUI interaction is available.
Gets the Java AWT container associated with this bean context.
Returns the string representation of the contents of this color model object.
Returns the sub MIME type of this data flavor.
Returns the raw keycode of this menu shortcut.
This method instructs the bean that it should not use the GUI.
Write this ICC profile to a file.
Removes the specified action listener so that it no longer receives action events from this button.
Returns the name of the character encoding being used by this stream.
Parses a string and returns an AWT key stroke.
Deprecated as of JDK version 1.1, replaced by get block increment.
Returns true if the color space is CS sRGB.
Gets the locale for this bean context.
Copies pixels from raster src raster to this writable raster.
The read stream header method is provided to allow subclasses to read and verify their own stream headers.
Choose which rows and columns of the delivered int pixels are needed for the destination scaled image and pass through just those rows and columns that are needed, replicated as necessary.
Gets the system tray instance that represents the desktop's tray area.
Test if we are in design-mode.
Returns whether the two display modes are equal.
Called by bean context support superclass during construction and deserialization to initialize subclass transient state.
Removes the specified key listener so that it no longer receives key events from this component.
Deprecated as of JDK version 1.1, replaced by get bounds.
Retargets an event to a new source.
This method is obsolete and supplied for backwards compatibility only; new code should call get min size instead.
Calculates and returns the bitwise inclusive or of the status of all media that are tracked by this media tracker.
Determines whether or not the specified object is equal to this arc2d.
Gets the warning string that is displayed with this window.
This is a convenience method to aid in the implementation of the common-case mouse wheel listener - to scroll a scroll pane or JScrollPane by an amount which conforms to the platform settings.
Deprecated as of 1.4, replaced by is focusable.
Removes the specified focus listener so that it no longer receives focus events from this component.
Deprecated as of JDK version 1.1, replaced by get component count.
Gets the insets of the screen.
Called when an ancestor of the source is resized.
Determines whether an image consumer is on the list of consumers currently interested in data for this image.
Returns any exception caught while executing the runnable's run method.
Analogous to java.lang.ClassLoader.getResource, this method allows a bean context implementation to interpose behavior between the child component and underlying class loader.
Returns the number of glyphs in this font.
Removes the specified focus listener so it no longer receives focus events from this component.
Checks the error status of all of the images tracked by this media tracker with the specified identifier.
Return the layout path, or null if the layout path is the default path; x maps to advance, y maps to offset.
Returns a map of font attributes available in this font.
Removes the specified flavor listener so that it no longer receives flavor events from this clipboard.
Determine if an image consumer is on the list of consumers currently interested in data for this image.
Indicates whether this dialog is undecorated.
Gets the label of this check box.
Determines whether or not the specified object is equal to this ellipse2d.
Gets the number of menus on the menu bar.
Write the specified object to the output stream.
Get the role of this object.
Gets the methods of the target listener interface.
Return the serial version UID for this class.
Returns whether or not the pixel is valid.
This method returns the user drop action.
Writes the specified byte to this output stream.
Indicates whether this frame is undecorated.
Returns the nth accessible child of the object.
Determines whether this component is showing on screen.
Tries to load a class from: the bootstrap loader, the system loader, the context loader if one is present and finally the loader specified.
Gets a bean info array, one for each service class or interface statically available from this service provider.
Sets the title for this frame to the specified string.

Note: This interface is required to permit the safe association of a drop target with a component in one of two ways, either: Component.setDropTarget(DropTarget); or DropTarget.setComponent(Component);.
Writes a sub array of bytes.
Returns a set view of the keys contained in this rendering hints.
Produce the message and include the classname, if present.
Determines whether this component is enabled.
Selects all the text in this text component.
Returns whether or not this event has been consumed.
Called when a child or list of children is added to a bean context that this listener is registered with.
Adds an AWT event listener to receive all AWT events dispatched system-wide that conform to the given event mask.
Prompts the layout manager to lay out this component.
Choose which rows and columns of the delivered byte pixels are needed for the destination scaled image and pass through just those rows and columns that are needed, replicated as necessary.
Deprecated as of JDK version 1.1, replaced by get menu count.
Gets the start position of the selected text in this text component.
Figures out the minimum size of the master based on the information from get layout info.
Returns whether this window is an always-on-top window.
Returns whether this component can be focused.
Returns a list of all media that have encountered an error.
Convert a hit to a point in standard coordinates.
Returns hash code for this data flavor.
Returns a cached instance of AWT KeyStroke or a subclass of AWT KeyStroke which is equal to this instance.
Disables the events defined by the specified event mask parameter from being delivered to this component.
A convenience method to set the owner's read permission for this abstract pathname.
Handles the ancestor moved event by invoking the ancestor moved methods on listener - a and listener - b.
Returns true if this rendering hints contains no key-value mappings.
Handles the caret position changed event by invoking the caret position changed methods on listener - a and listener - b.
Sets the owner's or everybody's read permission for this abstract pathname.
Adds the specified container listener to receive container events from this container.
Determine if the object is enabled.
Returns the rendering hints used by this op.
Returns whether this menu shortcut is the same as another: equality is defined to mean that both menu shortcuts use the same key and both either use or don't use the shift key.
Removes the specified text event listener so that it no longer receives text events from this text component. If l is null, no exception is thrown and no action is performed.
Writes the specified byte to this file output stream.
Invoked by bean context services, this method requests an instance of a service from this bean context service provider.
Handles the window opened event by invoking the window opened methods on listener - a and listener - b.
A value of true denotes that JavaBeans should behave in design time mode, a value of false denotes runtime behavior.
Deprecated as of JDK version 1.1, replaced by set unit increment(int).
Gets the item located at the specified index of this menu.
Finds all the applets in the document represented by this applet context.
Returns the bit masks for all bands.
Changes to a new int array to hold the pixels for this image.
Paint a representation of the value into a given area of screen real estate.
Reads two input bytes and returns an int value in the range 0 through 65535.
Get the menu shortcut object associated with this menu item.
Returns an array of all the item listeners registered on this checkbox.
Returns the human presentable name for this data flavor if param name equals "human presentable name".
Returns the number of components in the lookup table.
Returns whether any tile is checked out for writing.
A convenience method to set the owner's write permission for this abstract pathname.
Gets the layout manager for this container.
Sets the specified menu to be this menu bar's help menu.
Connects this piped writer to a receiver.
This method returns an int representing the type of actions this drag and drop operation will support.
Gets the end position of the selected text in this text component.
Get the rendering context of the font within this graphics2d context.
Writes a long to the underlying output stream as eight bytes, high byte first.
Redispatches an AWT event in such a way that the AWT event dispatcher will not recursively request that the keyboard focus manager, or any installed key event dispatchers, dispatch the event again.
The set dimensions method is part of the Image Consumer API which this class must implement to retrieve the pixels.
Creates the peer of the checkbox item.
Returns whether pages using these attributes will be rendered in color or monochrome.
Removes the specified action listener so that it no longer receives action events from this text field.
If this window is visible, brings this window to the front and may make it the focused window.
Deprecated this method does not properly convert bytes to characters. See DataInputStream for the details and alternatives.
Checks whether two Insets objects are equal.
Checks whether two rectangles are equal.
Specifies whether drawing at 0,0 to pages using these attributes draws at the upper-left corner of the physical page, or at the upper-left corner of the printable area.
Gets the directory of this file dialog.
Returns the number of tiles in the y direction.
Gets the input context used by this component for handling the communication with input methods when text is entered in this component.
Returns whether a tile is currently checked out for writing.
Returns a hashcode for this font.
Returns whether or not all of the pixels are valid.
Determines whether this component should be visible when its parent is visible.
Returns the primary MIME type for this data flavor.
Handles the ancestor resized event by invoking the ancestor resized methods on listener - a and listener - b.
Returns a set view of the mappings contained in this rendering hints.
Writes a short to the underlying output stream as two bytes, high byte first.
Gets a copy of this bean context's children.
Returns the number of copies the application should render for jobs using these attributes.
Adds the specified action listener to receive action events from this button.
Inserts a separator at the specified position.
Gets all the objects currently registered as foo listeners upon this drag source.
Primitive data write of this string in modified UTF-8 format.
Gets the method used to access the registered event listeners.
Repaints the specified rectangle of this component.
Get the font metrics of this object.
Enables event delivery to this menu item for events to be defined by the specified event mask parameter.
Writes len bytes from the specified byte array starting at offset off to this output stream.
Returns the number of banks in this data buffer.
Moves the focus down one focus traversal cycle.
Dispatches an event to this component or one of its sub components.
Calls painter to render the pages in the specified format.
Removes the specified action listener so that it no longer receives action events from this list.
Gets the visible amount of this scroll bar.
Changes to a new byte array to hold the pixels for this image.
Deprecated as inconsistent with hash code contract, use isMimeTypeEqual(String) instead.
Creates the peer for this label.
The writeObject is a single entry point to the persistence and is used by a encoder in the traditional mode of delegation.
Returns the graphics device where the mouse pointer was at the moment this PointerInfo was created.
Deprecated as of JDK version 1.1, replaced by get minimum size.
Determines whether the splash screen is visible.
Makes the item at the specified index visible.
When an instance of this class is used as a delegate for the implementation of the BeanContext protocols and its subprotocols there exists a 'chicken and egg' problem during deserialization.
Reads len bytes from an input stream.

Calculates a page format with values consistent with those supported by the current print service for this job, i.e., the value returned by getPrintService, and media, printable area, and orientation contained in attributes.
The setColorModel method is part of the ImageConsumer API which this class must implement to retrieve the pixels.
Returns the size of the table for a specified tag.
Gets the selected items on this scrolling list.
Checks this event to determine whether or not the service being revoked is of a particular class.
Sets this check box's group to the specified check box group.
Returns the numeric key code for this AWT KeyStroke.
Subclasses can override this method to insert their own subclass of child without having to override add or the other collection methods that add children to the set.
Returns true if this text layout is vertical.
Determines if this applet is active.

If passed to the appropriate variant of Java Beans beans instantiate, this method will be called in order to associate the newly instantiated applet Java bean with its applet context, applet stub, and container.
Returns a copy of the current transform in the Graphics2D context.
Gets the package names that will be searched for property editors.
Returns the width of the volatile image.
This method returns an int indicating if the source is in the same JVM as the target.
Gets the class object for the target interface.
Writes len bytes from the specified byte array starting at offset off to this piped output stream.
Handles the mouse moved event by invoking the mouse moved methods on listener - a and listener - b.
Returns the transparency mode for this texture paint.
Determines whether two page attributes are equal to each other.

Notify the drop target that it has been associated with a component. This method is usually called from java.awt.Component.addNotify of the component associated with this drop target to notify the drop target that a component peer has been associated with that component.
Reads bytes, blocking until all bytes are read.
Returns true if the specified object is a text layout object and if the specified object equals this text layout.
Constructs an ICC profile corresponding to the data in an input stream.
Returns true if this is a standard glyph.
Returns whether this AWT KeyStroke represents a key release.
Returns the pixel bit stride in bits.
Gets the areas of interest currently contained in the render context.

If the default drag cursor behavior is active, this method sets the default drag cursor for the specified actions supported by the drag source, the drop target action, and status, otherwise this method does nothing.
Paints each of the components in this container.
Replaces an entry in the list of source with a new source.
Used to determine if the bean context child is avoiding using its GUI.
Gets all JavaBean or BeanContext instances currently nested in this BeanContext.
Specify stream protocol version to use when writing the stream.
Gets the accessible context associated with this menu bar.
Recursively descends the container tree and recomputes the layout for any subtrees marked as needing it (those marked as invalid).
This method returns the drag source this drag gesture recognizer will use in order to process the drag and drop operation.
Get the color model for the pixels stored in the array.
Fires a bean context service event notifying of a service being revoked.
Returns the number of bytes available to this virtual machine on the partition named by this abstract pathname.
Changes this memory image into a multi-frame animation or a single-frame static image depending on the animated parameter.
Returns the difference in milliseconds between the timestamp of when this event occurred and midnight, January 1, 1970 UTC.
Adds the specified focus listener to receive focus events from this component.
Returns the location of the key that originated this key event.
Writes the complete contents of this byte array output stream to the specified output stream argument, as if by calling the output stream's write method using out.write(buf, 0, count).
Gets the block increment of this scroll bar.
Sets the composite for the Graphics2D context.
Returns the parent container for this menu component.
Return a hashcode for this FontRenderContext.
Returns the parameter string representing the state of this menu shortcut.
Returns the hash code value for this rendering hints.
The setHints method is part of the ImageConsumer API which this class must implement to retrieve the pixels.
Determines whether or not two points are equal.
Enables the events defined by the specified event mask parameter to be delivered to this component.
Adds an image to the list of images being tracked by this media tracker.
Request the image or image producer to start delivering pixels and wait for all of the pixels in the rectangle of interest to be delivered.
Handles the component removed container event by invoking the component removed methods on listener - a and listener - b.
Returns the width of the page in 1/72nds of an inch.
Get the accessible action associated with this object.
Adds a service to this bean context.
Returns whether this container is the root of a focus traversal cycle.
The equals method for all key objects will return the same result as the equality operator '=='.
Returns the height of the buffered image.
Writes a string as a sequence of chars.
Selects the best text data flavor from an array of data flavors.
Constructs an ICC profile corresponding to the data in an input stream.
Returns true if this is a standard glyph.
